newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile shares end down, seen steady next week.
newsitem.headline: Chile shares end down, seen steady next week.

text.p: Chilean blue chips closed softer Friday as news of stronger-than-expected June economic growth diminished hopes of an early cut in interest rates, said traders.
The market is expected to remain steady next week with light volume depriving the bolsa of momentum, they said.
"Next week will be a period of consolidation," said Pedro Santa Maria, finance manager of brokerage Socimer. "I don't see any substantial changes unless some market-moving news emerges."
The 40-share IPSA index ended down 0.72 percent at 97.65 points. The IGPA index declined 0.45 percent to 5,365.56 points.
Volume rose to 22.6 billion pesos with turnover boosted by an offering of nine billion pesos of Soquimich A series shares, said traders.
Dealers noted heavy speculative trading in power utilities Endesa and Enersis.
Traders reported a flurry of sell orders after the central bank said the economy expanded 6.3 percent in June compared with analysts' forecasts of a five percent increase.
Analysts said the report may just have been a one-off blip, with other indicators, including retail sales figures, pointing to a slowdown in economic growth.
The central bank previously said it would not reduce interest rates until the economy has cooled and inflationary pressures eased.
Losers included winery Concha y Toro, down 2.45 percent at 159 pesos, forestry firm Masisa, down 2.44 percent at 200 pesos, and telecoms company CTC, which fell 1.51 percent to 2,290 pesos.

Gainers included power distributor Chilquinta, up 1.38 percent at 2,180 pesos, Banco O'Higgins, up 0.33 percent at 1,530 pesos, and fertilizer company Soquimich , which rose 0.23 percent at 2,135 pesos.
